Sentencas: The main purpose of this work is to verify the influence of the addition of lithium on the densification and electrical conductivity of a gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte.
Titulo: Influence of Lithium on the Sintering Behavior and Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The lithium dopant was added directly during the sol-gel synthesis without a grinding step or the use of a dispersant solution.
Titulo: Influence of Lithium on the Sintering Behavior and Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Electrolytes were prepared from powders and sintered at 1250 and 1500 degrees C.
Titulo: Influence of Lithium on the Sintering Behavior and Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The characterization techniques used were XRD, FTIR spectroscopy, SEM, BET analysis, and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy for ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Influence of Lithium on the Sintering Behavior and Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The densification achieved was >97 and >99% of the theoretical density at sintering temperatures of 1250 and 1500 degrees C, respectively, by adding 2mol% of lithium.
Titulo: Influence of Lithium on the Sintering Behavior and Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The densification of gadolinium-doped ceria is caused by lithium deposition in the grain boundaries, which reduces structural imperfections.
Titulo: Influence of Lithium on the Sintering Behavior and Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The ionic conductivity of lithium-doped pellets sintered at 1250 degrees C is the same as that of pure ones sintered at 1500 degrees C with a maximum value of 5.2x10(-2)Scm(-1) at 800 degrees C. Lithium addition is an effective strategy to reduce the sintering temperature and retain high conductivity values.
Titulo: Influence of Lithium on the Sintering Behavior and Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 for Intermediate-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
